message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
Map<Integer, String> map = new HashMap<>();
map.put(100, "white");
map.put(200, "black");
map.put(300, "red");

List<Map.Entry<Integer, String>> list = new ArrayList<>(map.entrySet());
Collections.shuffle(list);

Map<Integer, String> shuffledMap = new LinkedHashMap<>();
for (Map.Entry<Integer, String> entry : list) {
    shuffledMap.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use a HashMap to store your key-value pairs. To shuffle them, you can convert the entry set of the map to a list and use Collections.shuffle to shuffle the list. Then, you can create a new LinkedHashMap (which maintains the insertion order) and populate it with the shuffled list. This way, you can shuffle your key-value pairs while still being able to revert to the original order if needed.
